alert.note: Alert for Chattahoochee; Macon; Marion; Muscogee; Schley; Stewart; Talbot; Taylor (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 10 at 8:12AM EST by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Macon, Marion, central Muscogee, Chattahoochee, northeastern Stewart, northwestern Schley, southwestern Talbot and southwestern Taylor Counties through 845 AM EST... At 812 AM EST, a line of strong thunderstorms was along a line extending from near Fort Benning/lawson Army Air Fld to near Junction City, and moving southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Up to 40 mph wind, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Buena Vista, Cusseta, Ideal, Junction City, Geneva, North Fort Benning, Fort Benning/lawson Army Air Fld, Brantley, Juniper, Vista Terrace, Rupert, Jamestown/south Fort Benning, Renfroe, Oakland, Manta, Zellobee, Howard, Tazewell, Doyle and Eelbeck/West Fort Benning. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning.

area.areaDesc: Chattahoochee; Macon; Marion; Muscogee; Schley; Stewart; Talbot; Taylor
